questions.question: Explain the phenomenon of cavitation in a centrifugal pump.
tips: Cavitation occurs when vapor bubbles form and collapse inside the pump.
Causes: Low pressure or high temperature at the suction side.
Effects: Damage to impeller, noise, and vibration.
Prevent by ensuring sufficient NPSH, maintaining proper suction conditions.

questions.question: What are the main equipment of a distillation loop?
tips: Main equipment includes distillation column, reboiler, and condenser.
Also involves reflux drum, pumps, and control valves.
Columns separate components based on boiling points.

questions.question: Explain the principle of the flow regulation loop, by using a simple drawing.
tips: Flow regulation loop controls the flow rate of a fluid.
Consists of a flow sensor, controller, and control valve.
Sensor measures flow, controller adjusts valve to maintain setpoint.
Diagram: [Flow Sensor] -> [Controller] -> [Control Valve]

questions.question: What does NPSH mean? Why is it important?
tips: NPSH: Net Positive Suction Head.
NPSH Available (NPSHA): Pressure at pump suction.
NPSH Required (NPSHR): Minimum pressure to avoid cavitation.
Ensures proper pump operation, prevents cavitation.

questions.question: What is draft in a furnace? Explain Natural draft.
tips: Draft: Pressure difference to draw air/gases through furnace.
Natural draft: relies on temperature difference and chimney height to create airflow, no mechanical fans.
Hot gases rise, creating a pressure difference.

questions.question: What is hydrotest and where is it used?
tips: Hydrotest: Pressure test using water.
Used to check leaks and strength in pipelines, vessels.
Ensures safety and integrity before operation.

questions.question: How do you clean pipes after construction?
tips: Methods: Flushing, blowing, pigging, chemical cleaning.
Flushing uses water to remove debris.
Blowing uses air or steam to cleanup gas lines
Pigging uses devices (pigs) to scrub and clean.
Chemical cleaning dissolves contaminants.

questions.question: How is Instrument loop check performed?
tips: Basically verify signal transmission from sensor to controller to actuator.
Loop Check: verifies that signal from sensor to controller and back to the actuator is working
Functional test: verify instrument operation under simulated conditions.
Calibration: compare instrument readings to a known standard.
Range check: ensure instrument operates within its specified range.
Accuracy check: verify accuracy of instrument readings.
Response time check: measure time for instrument to respond to changes.

questions.question: Name types of trays in distillation towers.
tips: Types: Sieve trays, valve trays, bubble cap trays.
Bubble cap tray: vapor passes through caps and bubbles through liquid.
Sieve tray: vapor passes through holes in the tray and bubbles through liquid.
Valve tray: valves open and close to allow vapor to pass through liquid.

questions.question: Explain the phenomenon of ‘surge’ in a centrifugal compressor and how to prevent it?
tips: Surge in a centrifugal compressor occurs when the flow rate falls below a critical level.
It results in flow reversal and can cause severe mechanical damage.
To prevent surge, maintain the flow above the surge line using anti-surge control systems.
Install surge control valves and ensure proper system design.

questions.question: What is H2S? Explain the importance between a range of 0-10 ppm and above 10 ppm?
tips: H2S, or hydrogen sulfide, is a toxic and flammable gas.
At 0-10 ppm, it has a noticeable rotten egg smell and can cause irritation to the eyes, nose, and throat.
Above 10 ppm, it can cause severe health effects and is considered dangerous.
Strict safety measures must be in place to monitor and control H2S levels, including personal protective equipment, ventilation, and emergency procedures.

questions.question: What is hammering? Why does it occur? How can it be avoided?
tips: Condensate hammering occurs when steam condenses into liquid water.
This is often caused by sudden changes in flow rate or temperature, such as when a valve is closed rapidly or a steam trap fails.
It can result in loud banging noises, vibrations, and potential damage to the steam system.
To prevent condensate hammering, ensure proper steam trap installation to remove condensate efficiently.

questions.question: What is the purpose of doing a nitrogen purge for on equipment or unit?
tips: Nitrogen purge removes oxygen and other contaminants from equipments to prevent fires, explosions, or other hazards.
It prevents oxidation and corrosion during shutdown or maintenance.
Nitrogen is a non-flammable and inert gas that can safely displace oxygen without creating a hazardous atmosphere.
It is essential before opening equipment for inspection or repair.

questions.question: What is Flash Point? What is Kerojet flash specification?
tips: Flash point is the lowest temperature at which a liquid will produce sufficient vapor to form an ignitable mixture with air.
Kerojet fuel has a flash point specification to ensure it is safe to handle and transport.
The flash point of Kerojet fuel is typically higher than that of gasoline to reduce the risk of ignition.

questions.question: What is the purpose of pumparound?
tips: Pumparound is a process used in distillation columns to improve separation efficiency.
It involves withdrawing a portion of the liquid from the column and returning it to a lower stage.
This helps to maintain a more uniform temperature profile in the column and improve product purity.

questions.question: What would cause: 1. Catalyst poisoning / 2. Catalyst aging?
tips: Catalyst poisoning occurs when contaminants in the feedstock react with the catalyst, reducing its activity.
Common causes of catalyst poisoning include sulfur compounds, heavy metals, and water.
Catalyst aging is a natural process that occurs over time, leading to a gradual decline in catalyst activity.
Aging can be accelerated by high temperatures, excessive pressure, and exposure to contaminants.

questions.question: Why is RVP important?
tips: RVP, or Reid Vapor Pressure, measures the volatility of gasoline.
used to stablize the gasoline products like slobe
Higher RVP indicates higher evaporation rate.
Control RVP to meet environmental regulations and performance standards.

questions.question: What are the important checks before starting a centrifugal compressor?
tips: Ensure that all safety valves are operational.
Ensure all auxiliaries are in service
eg, Lube oil, Sealing System, Cooling Water
Ensure Compressor casing drains are open for any accumulated liquid
Ensure the suction and discharge isolations are open.
inspect for leaks.
Ensure that the anti-surge control system is active.

questions.question: How to put centrifugal pump in stand-by after maintenance?
tips: Ensure the pump is properly aligned and lubricated.
Fill the pump casing with liquid to avoid dry running.
Take sealing system in service
Open the discharge valve to put in ready state.
Keep the suction valve open and the pump primed for immediate use.
